ajaxbrowser.transition module¶

class ajaxbrowser.transition.JsonPath(steps)[source]¶

Wrapper to iterate through a dictionary given a list of indices / keys

>>> jp = JsonPath([0, 'person'])
>>> jp([{'person': 'richard'}, {'person': 'tim'}])
'richard'
>>> jp([])
class ajaxbrowser.transition.Transition(reply, js)[source]¶

Wrapper around a single transition using the QNetworkReply, which will be deleted by Qt so a local copy of details is necessary

matches(expected_output, content=None)[source]¶

Return whether the expected output is found in this transition

ajaxbrowser.transition.generate_path(data, goal, parents=None)[source]¶

Find the path to the goal in this data structure

>>> js = [{'person': 'richard', 'location': 'oxford'}, {'person': 'tim', 'location': 'oxford'}]
>>> [jp.steps for jp in generate_path(js, 'richard')]
[(0, 'person')]
>>> [jp.steps for jp in generate_path(js, 'oxford')]
[(0, 'location'), (1, 'location')]
>>> [jp.steps for jp in generate_path(js, 'cambridge')]
[]
ajaxbrowser.transition.json_values(es)[source]¶

Recursively parse values from this json dict

>>> list(json_values({'name': 'bob', 'children': ['alice', 'sarah']}))
['bob', 'alice', 'sarah']
